page.title: 19Shalford Women's Institute
page.content: The{Shalford W.I.}was formed in 1920 and so has celebrated its{Diamond {Jubilee. }When it began there was no village hall and meetings were held in the school on Saturday afternoons. Village living conditions and way of life have changed completely and, with these changes, the subjects of the groups monthly talks. Such skills as shoe repairing and rabbit skinning are no longer greatly needed but the format for the meetings remains the same - business, educational and social. In 1985 members have heard about wholefood cookery (fast gaining in popularity), experiences of a police woman, coaching holidays at home and abroad and how to relieve stress. The exhibit at the{County Show demonstrates the high standard and many skills of ordinary members.
